title: Ticket #3848: ENABLE_DEPRECATION_WARNINGS defaults to true
description:
Dear HTCondor team.

I just noticed that ENABLE_DEPRECATION_WARNINGS default to true in 8.0.1.

According to the manual, it should default to false: http://research.cs.wisc.edu/htcondor/manual/v8.0/3_3Configuration.html#21320

And that's what CMS AnaOps was expecting as well.

Now, it is not too difficult to explicitly set it to false in the config files, but it is annoying. Can you please fix it?
remarks:
2013-Aug-12 14:33:10 by wenger: 

  manta(678)% condor_version
  $CondorVersion: 8.0.2 Jul 18 2013 BuildID: UW_development PRE-RELEASE-UWCS $
$CondorPlatform: X86_64-RedHat_6.4 $
  manta(679)% condor_config_val ENABLE_DEPRECATION_WARNINGS
  true
  manta(680)%

2013-Aug-12 17:13:09 by johnkn:
It was true for DEVELOPER and false for STABLE. Once the 7.9.x DEVELOPER became the 8.0 STABLE it became true for STABLE. This is not a bug, there should be a limit to how long we permit the use of obsolete features without warnings.

I have reset the param to false for 8.0, but I don't think it's actually a good idea. They wouldn't be seeing this warning if they weren't doing something that is obsolete - as in guaranteed to give wrong results with partitionable slots.

2013-Aug-13 09:37:05 by wenger:
CODE REVIEW

Code change looks fine; needs a version history item.
check_ins:
2013-Aug-16 11:57   Check-in [37252]: minor 8.0.2 version history item edit ===GT=== #3848 (By Karen Miller )
2013-Aug-13 15:48   Check-in [37198]: version history for #3848 (By John (TJ) Knoeller )
2013-Aug-12 17:07   Check-in [37174]: change default value of ENABLE_DEPRECATION_WARNINGS to false for stable #3848 (By John (TJ) Knoeller )
creator: wenger
